ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] New expansion Beta Open
ygData.msgSnippet: Well I had my first experience with the beta.  I created a dru9id but then I used the /betabuff command.  Of course I chose /betabuff druid 70.  I ve neve
ygData.messageBody:
Well I had my first experience with the beta.  I created a dru9id but then I used the /betabuff command.  Of course I chose /betabuff druid 70.  I've neve rbeen a level 70 before.  Boy was I shocked.  Full Time Gear!  200 AA points and 4 100% weight reduction bags!  I'm so sickened now that my maind oesn't have all that!  And every spell up to level 70.  Unbelievable. 
 
So went to Darkhollow.  there are several zones you can go to once you get there, but just the first zone the greenies aggro like mad.  I nuked one for over 2k and it barely took it down to half health.  NASTY!!!
 
I died, needless to say. 
 
So we'll see what happens.
 
Wulfric
 
 
 
 
 
 
----- Original Message -----
From: Wulfric Rennison
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, August 04, 2005 8:30 PM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] New expansion Beta Open

I'm such an idiot!!  Talk about boneheaded mistakes.  I figured out why the beta wasn't working.
 
My dumb self ran the beta patcher from within the zip file folder.  It was tryign to download files into a folder that's non-existant.  So they were being stored in memory and when memory filled up, the game would crash.
 
Once I unzipped the actual files and put them in a non-archived folder, the patcher ran fine, although now it has to redownload everything.
 
Okay so now that I admit I'm not perfect, I'll let you know what the beta is like once I play it.
 
Wulfric
 
 
 
 
 
----- Original Message -----
From: Wulfric Rennison
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, August 04, 2005 8:12 PM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] New expansion Beta Open

Well I'd love to tell ya if I could ever get into the damn thing!  It's till not working for me!
  From the small bit I did see, they've added 2 new tabs to the Inventory window.  One says Evolving Weapons, and the other one says Monster Alts.  The latest patch message I saw said that the monster alts was not working yet.  And some NPCs whose character models are not in zone yet are replaced by the standard human model.  They call this model "Doug".
 
 
Wulfric
 
 
 
 
----- Original Message -----
From: Nick Thompson
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, August 04, 2005 6:43 PM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] New expansion Beta Open

Congrats on hitting the beta, you lucky dog you.  /e
drools at thought of intelligent weapons........

--- Wulfric Rennison <wulftech@...> wrote:

> I saw a systemwide message ing ame today that said
> the beta was now open.  the registration for it only
> lasted for about 15 minutes though so you had to
> register in that time.  I imagine they will announce
> open testing registration periodically as the time
> draws near for its live release.  I did get
> registered and spent a pretty good hour plus
> downloading the beta files.  I have yet to play it,
> but I copied the email I received so people can see
> what it says.
>
>
> Wulfric
>
> PS  Dont ask me for the FTP site address.  I wont
> give it to you.
>
>
>
>
> Welcome to the EverQuest(R) Depths of Darkhollow(TM)
> (DoD) beta!  Please read this entire email
> carefully. It contains all the information you will
> need to hit the ground running and make the most of
> your time in beta. Remember, you accepted the
> EverQuest Terms of Use, License and Non-Disclosure
> Agreement as a condition for acceptance into the
> beta program, and everything included here as well
> as what you see on the beta server, in beta-related
> communications and beta forums and message boards
> are covered by that agreement.
>
>
> HOW DO I GET ON THE BETA SERVER?
>
> In order to access the Depths of Darkhollow beta
> server, you will need to download the Beta patcher.
> The FTP site for downloading the patcher is listed
> below. There may be a lot of data to download, so
> please be patient.  You should run this patcher
> before you log in, every time.  Failing to do so may
> cause you to experience crashes or gameplay issues
> that could be fixed just by patching.
>
>
> You may download the Depths of Darkhollow beta
> patcher at the following FTP site
>
>
> FTP Site omitted due to NDA.
>
>
> To get to the ftp site:
>
> Enter the ftp address into your Internet Explorer
> web browser.  It will bring you to the ftp site. The
> file you need is called EQBetaPatcher.zip.  Just
> right click on the file and copy it to your desktop.
>  Unzip the file and copy betaeverquest.exe into your
> root EverQuest directory (Should be in C:\Program
> Files\Sony\EverQuest unless you changed your default
> installation.)
>
> Run this every time prior to logging in to the beta
> server. You will see the Beta Server on the server
> list, choose that server and log in.
>
>
> HOW LONG IS BETA?
>
> The beta test is scheduled to begin on July 20th,
> 2005 and is scheduled to end on September 13th,
> 2005, unless we decide to change these dates.
>
>
> HOW DO I GET TO THE DoD ZONES?
>
> When you get onto the beta server, create your
> character and head to the Plane of Knowledge. Find
> Old Man Thorren and he can teleport you to Corathus
> Creep.
>
>
> HOW DO I COPY MY CHARACTER ONTO BETA?
>
> For us to copy your favorite EverQuest character to
> the beta server, please indicate which character you
> want us to copy by logging into your play server as
> your favorite character. You indicate that you want
> us to copy an individual character by typing the
> command /beta in your chat window. Periodically we
> will run scripts that will copy characters to the
> beta server. Keep in mind that we will be running
> the character copies on an as-needed basis - not
> necessarily at regular intervals. It may take
> several days for us to copy your character.
>
>
> THE /betabuff COMMAND
>
> The level range needed to test all of the variations
> of dungeons for  DoD is huge.  In order to give you
> that ability to test as much of the expansion as
> possible, we have created a /betabuff command.
> Here's how you use it.
>
> 1. Create a first level character on the beta server
> and log in with that character (this command will
> only work on 1st level characters).
>
> 2. Type /betabuff CLASS LEVEL - where CLASS is the
> class of the character you would like to create, and
> LEVEL is the level that you want that character to
> be.  LEVEL can only be numbers divisible by 5,
> starting at 20.  So 20, 25, 30, etc.
>
> That's it.  The character you created will be
> transformed into a character of the level and class
> you have chosen.  Your race and even gender may
> change as well.
>
>
> BETA FEEDBACK
>
> There are two methods for passing information to us
> about what you experience during the beta.
>
> /bug should be used to report bugs.  Bugs are
> gameplay features that do not work, spelling errors,
> and anything that just does not work as intended.
> Please give us as much detail about the bug as you
> can think of when reporting it.
>
> /feedback should be used to send in comments about
> parts of the expansion that work properly, but that
> you would like to see changed.  If you discover an
> item that you think should have less Wis and more
> Int, then use /feedback.  If you think a certain
> encounter is too easy or too hard, use /feedback to
> report it.
>
> It is important that you distinguish between these
> two options, as one is read primarily by our testing
> team and the other is read mostly by our game
> designers.  Sending a bug through /feedback can
> delay our ability to fix it, since we'll have to
> route that to our testers for verification.
>
> Please use this command to explore as many of the
> adventures as you can and report your findings to
> us.
>
> If you find yourself in dire need of assistance, you
> can use /petition to contact us for help.  Please
> only petition if the situation is one that you can't
> correct yourself.  For example, if you used
> /betabuff to create a character and you have lost
> the corpse, there is no need to /petition.  You can
> just log out, create a new character and use the
> /betabuff command again.
>
> Please remember that your participation in the beta
> program is subject to the Terms of Use, License and
> Non-Disclosure Agreement ("Agreement") which you
> have already agreed to. Your access in and to the
> beta program, including the patcher, is for your
> personal, non-commercial use only, in accordance
> with the Agreement, and any feedback you provide is
> confidential.
>
> Thank you for your time and effort; we appreciate
> your help testing this expansion.
>
> Sincerely,
>
>
> The EverQuest Depths of Darkhollow Development Team
>
>
>
